If you issue an invalid request to the Cisco Unified Call Manager Administrative XML SOAP API (AXL), it returns a 500 error response that includes XML. Under Windows PowerShell 5.1, this XML is available in the `ErrorDetails.Message` property. Under PowerShell 6.1.2 and 6.2.0-Preview.4 you do not get the XML tags

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$IWRParams = @{
                 Headers    = @{ 'Content-Type' = 'text/xml; charset=utf-8' }
                 Body       = '<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:ns="http://www.cisco.com/AXL/API/11.5"><soapenv:Header/><soapenv:Body><ns:doLdapSync><name>ldapsyn</name><sync>true</sync></ns:doLdapSync></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>'
                 Uri        = "https://10.10.20.1/axl/"
                 Method     = 'Post'
                 Credential = (Get-Credential)
 SkipCertificateCheck = $true
             }
 Invoke-WebRequest @IWRParams
```

# Expected behavior

When catching the exception, the `ErrorDetails.Message` should contain the entire results returned from the server.

```none
#When run from Windows PowerShell 5.1:
PS C:\Users\corbob> $error[0].errordetails.message
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?><soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"><soapenv:Body><soapenv:Fault><faultcode>soapenv:Server</faultcode><faultstring>Item not valid: The specified ldapsyn was not found</faultstring><detail><axlError><axlcode>5007</axlcode><axlmessage>Item not valid: The specified ldapsyn was not found</axlmessage><request>doLdapSync</request></axlError></detail></soapenv:Fault></soapenv:Body></soapenv:Envelope>
```

# Actual behavior

XML tags are being stripped out

```none
C:\Users\corbob> $error[0].errordetails.message
soapenv:ServerItem not valid: The specified ldapsyn was not found5007Item not valid: The specified ldapsyn was not founddoLdapSync
```
